name: The Charge of the Light Brigade Online Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.text: The soldiers that survived the battle came through the _____ of death, as it says in stanza five of "The Charge of the Light Brigade".
questions.explanation:
Jaws.

	One-hundred ninety-five British soldiers survived the battle with the Russian forces. Those men came through the jaws of death.

questions.text: At the end of "The Charge of the Light Brigade", what adjective describes the six hundred men?
questions.explanation:
Noble.

	The end of each of the six stanzas describes the six hundred men in some way. Stanza six describes the men as noble.

questions.text: About which war was "The Charge of the Light Brigade" written?
questions.explanation:
Crimean War.

	The poem was written about the Battle of Balaclava which took place on October 25, 1894 during the Crimean War. British forces led by Lord Raglan fought against Russian forces led by Paul Liprandi, and the British were defeated.

questions.text:
Complete the quote. 

"Theirs not to make reply
Theirs not to reason why
Theirs but to do and ___."
questions.explanation:
Die.

	The British soldiers followed Lord Raglan into the valley of death to the other side. Once they reached the other side, more than two-hundred and seventy-five of the six hundred men had been injured or killed of the six hundred that first rode into the valley.

questions.text:
What is the missing word from stanza six of "The Charge of the Light Brigade"?

"When can their _____ fade? 
Oh, the wild charge they made."
questions.explanation:
Glory.

	The poem begins with the phrase, 'Half a league'. This means the British forces either rode or walked one and a half miles to get to the valley.

questions.text: What did Tennyson nickname the valley where the British soldiers rode?
questions.explanation:
Valley of death.

	The "valley of death" Tennyson mentioned in the poem was the valley between the Fedyukhin and Causeway Heights.

questions.text: In stanza three of "The Charge of the Light Brigade", where was one of the places the cannons weren't aimed?
questions.explanation:
The back.

	With cannons aimed to the left, the front, and the right of them, the British soldiers continued onward. The Russian army had an estimated fifty pieces of artillery firing at the British soldiers.

questions.text: According to the first stanza of "The Charge of the Light Brigade", how many British forces rode into the battle?
questions.explanation:
Six hundred.

	Six hundred men rode half a league into the Battle of Balaclava. Half a league is one and a half miles.

questions.text: According to stanza four of "The Charge of the Light Brigade", what was the world doing while the battle was taking place?
questions.explanation:
Wondering.

	The British fought the Russians with swords and artillery, but in the end not all of the British forces returned.

questions.text: What honor was bestowed on Alfred, Lord Tennyson at the time he was writing "The Charge of the Light Brigade"?
questions.correct: He was Poet Laureate for the United Kingdom
options: He was invited to meet with the Queen
He met the President of the United States
questions.explanation:
He was Poet Laureate for the United Kingdom.

	Alfred, Lord Tennyson was poet laureate of the United Kingdom when he wrote this poem. The poem was published for the first time on December 9, 1854 in "The Examiner".
